title: Upgrading chain index stuck on bloombits error="block #16142464 [9efc5a81..] not found"
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `1.13.0-stable`
CL client & version: lighthouse@4.2.0
OS & Version: archLinux

#### Expected behaviour
Upgrading chain index type=bloombits should complete

#### Actual behaviour
My `Upgrading chain index` has been stuck for 7h on the same missing block error

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
Not sure what the cause is, this happened during a normal `removedb` and resync. I have attempted a restart after the first few occurrences of this error but that didn't fix anything and the same error keeps getting repeated

```
Upgrading chain index                    type=bloombits percentage=88
Syncing: state download in progress      synced=12.03% state=28.13GiB  accounts=26,568,059@5.36GiB   slots=105,293,132@21.87GiB codes=161,303@930.97MiB eta=2h19m31.220s
Syncing: chain download in progress      synced=99.92% chain=554.39GiB headers=18,126,093@8.26GiB bodies=18,111,605@388.17GiB receipts=18,111,605@157.96GiB eta=3m38.922s
Forkchoice requested sync to new head    number=18,126,094 hash=ce02d4..3cece2 finalized=18,126,009
Upgrading chain index                    type=bloombits percentage=89
Syncing: state download in progress      synced=12.08% state=28.32GiB  accounts=26,675,845@5.38GiB   slots=106,088,259@22.03GiB codes=161,657@933.16MiB eta=2h19m47.563s
Syncing: chain download in progress      synced=99.92% chain=554.39GiB headers=18,126,094@8.26GiB bodies=18,112,375@388.17GiB receipts=18,112,375@157.96GiB eta=3m27.277s
Upgrading chain index                    type=bloombits percentage=89
Forkchoice requested sync to new head    number=18,126,095 hash=947f13..9cd509 finalized=18,126,009
Syncing: state download in progress      synced=12.17% state=28.48GiB  accounts=26,870,389@5.42GiB   slots=106,642,678@22.14GiB codes=162,732@940.05MiB eta=2h19m23.555s
Section processing failed                type=bloombits error="block #16142464 [9efc5a81..] not found"
```

The missing block `16142464` should be present, the log tells `Syncing: chain download in progress      synced=99.92% chain=554.39GiB headers=18,126,094@8.26GiB bodies=18,112,375@388.17GiB receipts=18,112,375@157.96GiB eta=3m27.277s`

Did you keep the ancient folder when run `removedb`?

I just noticed what might have triggered it, the process was restarted accidentally while syncing - this triggered the bloom indexer. 

The ancient folder is indeed still present and the node was fully synced when I switched to pbss
Did you remove the key-value store(except the ancient) when you switch to pbss?
I manually removed the files in the `chaindata` directory (except `ancient/`) (due to permission challenges invoking the `geth` binary as correct user is challenging)
Can you please share the your command to launch Geth?

sure, that's
```
/usr/bin/geth --authrpc.addr 0.0.0.0 --authrpc.port $RPC_PORT --authrpc.vhosts '*' \
              --datadir $STATE_DIRECTORY --ipcdisable --state.scheme=path \
              --http --http.addr 0.0.0.0 --http.vhosts '*' --http.port $HTTP_PORT \
               --port $PORT
```

My first retry just failed btw, when the `chain download` reached 100% the `bloombits` resumed at the same point and failed again so I've now remove `ancient/state`as well and am trying again with an empty `chaindata` directory
Do you have the log before and after the restart?

```

```
second retry failed as well, the bloombits resumed again at `89%`. Does this mean `ancient` itself is corrupt as there isn't anything else to remove for me it seems?

`error="block #16142464 [9efc5a81..]`, one possibility is the canonical hash corresponds to number `16142464` is wrong in your original ancient, not sure why it happens.

The interesting thing is it's not canonical block https://etherscan.io/block/16142464
I'm trying to find another node to compare my data to, would it make sense to compare checksums to verify the `cdat` files?

Well, honestly I have no idea why the ancient store can be corrupted. May take long time to figure out the flaw under the skin.

If you can quickly compare the cdat files, it will be great(they should be identical, except the last file which may contain different items). 

Maybe you can fix it by replacing the incorrect ancient file, but I guess the quick solution is just to resync the entire node.
